humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions like a silk rope. Shirakawa thinks that the white-like wire bundle is tied up, soaked in a dye vat, and dyed black. The ancient meaning of " Xuan " is " black. " Probably because black has a little red color, the color is profound and remote, and it is difficult to distinguish. Later, it extends the meanings of profound, remote, and mysterious. "Shuowen": "Mysterious, distant and distant. Black and red is mystery. Like the lonely and into the overlying. All mysteries belong to the mystery. †µì, the ancient text and the mystery." Wang Yun's "Shu Wenju Reading" points to the ancient " Xuan " and " Yao " have the same form, but the sound and meaning are different. Jin Guotai, He Linyi and others believe that " Xuan " and " Yao " are the differentiation of the word. As for the extension of the meaning of " Xuan ", Lin Yiguang believes that the original meaning of " xuan " is the shape of silk, and the original meaning is hanging.

Jia Jin inscription means red and black, "Collection" 33276: "Three Profound Cows", that is, three red and black cows. Song Ding: "Yi (Gi) Girl (Ru) Xuan Yi Yu Tun (Pure)", " Pure " means the edge of the dress, meaning a red-black top with embroidered patterned edges. This kind of dress is used for worship and ceremonies.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States period are red and black, and the bamboo slips from the Tomb of the Marquis of Zeng Yi 79: "Xuan Yu", that is, red and black feathers. It also expresses profound and mysterious, "Guodian Jian. "Lao Zi Jia" Jan. 8: "A person who is good in ancient times must not be (micro) drowning (miao) xuanda, and profoundness (knowledge)." The short article says that people who are good at ancient times must be subtle and profound. , Deep and understanding, too deep to know (Liu Zhao). "Guodian Jane. "Lao Tzu A" Jane 27-28: "Close the door, match (plug) the door, harmonize (its) light, pass through the dust, extract the glory of (its), and solve it. It means the stomach (so-called) mystery.‚Äù It means closing its eyes, eyes, nose, mouth and other orifices, blocking the door of its body, and accumulating its brilliance, to gain access to its dust, to remove its edge, and to resolve its disputes. It is called "Xuan Tong" (Liu Zhao).

Basic explanation of words
mysterious
xu√°n
Profound and not easy to understand: mysterious. Mysterious. Xuan Li (a. Profound doctrine; b. Doctrine advertised by Wei Jin metaphysics). metaphysics. Mystery.
Hypocritical, untrue, unreliable: Xuanxiang. mystery.
Black: Xuanqing (dark black). Xuanwu (a. The god of the north in Taoism, its image is a combination of turtles and snakes; b. The collective name of the northern seven places in the twenty-eight places).
mysterious
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªxu√°nÔºΩ
["Guangyun" Hu Juanqie, Pingxian, Xie. ]
The false word for "‰º≠2" was passed.
(1) Crimson black. It is mostly used to refer to black.
(2) "Yi¬∑Kun": "The sky is mysterious and the ground is yellow." Kong Yingdashu: "The sky is mysterious, and the ground is yellow." Later, "Xuan" refers to the sky.
(3) North; north facing. See "Xuantang", "Xuanhai", "Xuanfang".
(4) Refers to Xuanjiu, the water used as wine in ancient sacrifices.
(5) Refers to water.
(6) Profound; mysterious.
(7) Refers to the profound truth.
(8) Far; far away.
(9) Big.
(10) Describes thick and dense. See "Xuan Yun", "Xuan Yin".
(11) Ancient Chinese philosophers refer to the ontology of the universe.
(12) In the book "Laozi", "Tao" is called "Xuanzhi and Xuan", and later because it refers to Taoism.
(13) Refers to Buddhism. See "Xuanjiang", "Xuanji".
(14) Through "hanging". Hang, hang high. See "Xuanquan", "Xuanpu".
(15) Last name. There is Xuanhe in the Han Dynasty. See "The Book of the Later Han¬∑The Fifth Lun Biography".
[‚ë°]Ôºªxu√†nÔºΩ
["Jiyun" cut silk, go to hail, box. ]
(1) Same as "Hyun". See "Xuan 2 Mix".
(2) Through "dazzle". Confused, confused.
(3) Through "Hyun".
